Detailed Description

This abstract class from which watchers meant to access indirect bases derive.

See also:
Watcher Module

Constructor.

Member Function Documentation

bool DereferenceWatcher::addChild ( const char *  path,
WatcherPtr  pChild,
void *  withBase = NULL 
) [virtual]

This method adds a watcher as a child to another watcher.

Parameters:
path The path of the watcher to add the child to.
pChild The watcher to add as a child.
withBase This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false. This method may fail if the watcher could not be found or the watcher cannot have children.

Reimplemented from Watcher.

virtual uintptr DereferenceWatcher::dereference ( const void *   )  const [protected, pure virtual]

Implemented in BaseDereferenceWatcher, SmartPointerDereferenceWatcher, and ContainerBounceWatcher< CONTAINER_TYPE, KEY_TYPE >.

bool DereferenceWatcher::getAsStream ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
WatcherPathRequestV2 &  pathRequest 
) const [virtual]

This method is used to get a stream representation of the value associated with the path.

The path is relative to this watcher. The stream is comprised of [data type] - (string/bool/int ...) [data mode] - (read only/read write) [data]

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is used.
pathRequest A reference to a Watcher protocol v2 PathRequest containing the stream that we store the watcher value in.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

Implements Watcher.

bool DereferenceWatcher::getAsString ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
std::string &  result,
std::string &  desc,
Watcher::Mode &  mode 
) const [virtual]

This method is used to get a string representation of the value associated with the path.

The path is relative to this watcher.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is used.
result A reference to a string where the resulting string will be placed.
desc A reference to a string that contains description of this watcher.
mode A reference to a watcher mode. It is set to the mode of the returned value.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

Implements Watcher.

bool DereferenceWatcher::setFromStream ( void *  base,
const char *  path,
WatcherPathRequestV2 &  pathRequest 
) [virtual]

This method sets the value of the watcher associated with the input path from a PathRequest.

The Path Request is an abstraction of the data associated with watcher path being queried.

NB: For asynchronous watcher set requests this method will always return success.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is set.
pathRequest A reference to the PathRequest object to use when setting the watcher's value.
Returns:
True if the new value was set, otherwise false.

Implements Watcher.

bool DereferenceWatcher::setFromString ( void *  base,
const char *  path,
const char *  valueStr 
) [virtual]

This method sets the value of the watcher associated with the input path from a string.

The path is relative to this watcher.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the value associated with this watcher is set.
valueStr A string representing the value which will be used to set to watcher's value.
Returns:
True if the new value was set, otherwise false.

Implements Watcher.

bool DereferenceWatcher::visitChildren ( const void *  base,
const char *  path,
WatcherPathRequest &  pathRequest 
) [virtual]

This method visits each child of a directory watcher.

Parameters:
base This is a pointer used by a number of Watchers. It is used as an offset into a struct or container.
path The path string used to find the desired watcher. If the path is the empty string, the children of this object are visited.
pathRequest The path request object to notify for each child owned by the directory watcher.
Returns:
True if the children were visited, false if specified watcher could not be found or is not a directory watcher.

Reimplemented from Watcher.
